author: Special Correspondent
text:
The regular operations in the branches of nationalised banks and scheduled banks across the district were hit following the strike by bank employees on Friday.

The All India Bank Employees’ Association (AIBEA) had given a call for nation-wide strike to protest against the “unfair” policies adopted by the State Bank of India with respect to its five associate banks - State Bank of Bikaner and Jaipur, State Bank of Travancore, State Bank of Mysore, State Bank of Hyderabad and State Bank of Patiala.

The striking bank men demanded that the associate banks should be delinked from the State Bank of India. The strike was also to protest against the India Banks Association which had gone back on its promises made in the agreement.

A large number of bank employees staged a demonstration in front of the branch of the State Bank of Travancore in the city.

K. Swaminathan, president of the Salem District Bank Employees Association, led the agitation. Kanchana, member, State Bank of Travancore Employees Union Committee, explained the demands. S. Sampath, general secretary of the Association, also spoke.

The banking operations were hit in Namakkal district too because of the strike.Erode

About 500 members of Erode District Bank Employees’ Association kept off from work on Friday heeding to a strike call by All India Bank Employees’ Association.

EDBEA president M. Jo Sukumar led the protests to register opposition to the ‘unacceptable’ labour policies adopted by State Bank of India with respect to its five associate banks.

The protestors condemned the SBI for extending its service conditions and career progression rules in associate banks, and sought delinking of the subsidiaries.
title: Strike hits regular operations in banks
